intro: Ruschia beaufortensis, commonly known as the Beaufort Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
